title: \* Announcing the Winner of the Typophile Tee! \*
content:
Ladies and Gentlemen,   
   
It gives us great joy to announce the long-anticipated winner of the first annual Typophile Tee contest. But first let's thank our judges, Rich Roat (House), Jonathan Hoefler (HTF), Erik van Blokland (Letterror), Carlos Segura (T26) and Cyrus Highsmith (Font Bureau), who gave of their time to help us select the winner today.   
   
We'll thank our judges by sending them copies of the winning tee for themselves and their staff.   
   
Without further ado, our winner was: shirt # 29.006, submitted by Mark Simonson!   
   
 ![29006front](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/72/3095.gif)   
 ![29006back](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/72/3096.gif)   
   
Mark will receive the $250 prize donated by Los Angeles-based [Apollo26](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.apollo26.com/) and three shirts to share with his loved ones. Typophile thanks Apollo26 for their support during this contest.   
   
The race was a close one! Here are the runners-up, in order:   
   
1st runner up: [05.003](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/1792.gif) by "etherbrian" (USA)   
2nd runner up: [38.019](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2357.gif) by Christopher Simmons (USA)   
3rd runner up: [18.007](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2064.gif) by James Grieshaber (USA)   
4th runner up: [43.015](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2451.gif) by Jmeno Obluda (USA)   
5th runner up: [45.011](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2498.gif) by Carlos Moreno (Spain)   
   
Other designs that received votes in the final round include:   
   
 [09.003](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/1825.gif) by Tommi Kortesniemi   
 [18.002](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2061.gif) by Allon Kaye (England)   
 [23.009](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2053.gif) by Joe Pemberton (USA)   
 [26.005](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2114.gif) by Peter Freedman (USA)   
 [37.005](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2312.gif) by Heinrich Lischka (Germany)   
 [38.018](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2355.gif) by Christopher Simmons (USA)   
 [38.020](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2359.gif) by Christopher Simmons (USA)   
 [45.002](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2486.gif) by Dave Bruck (USA)   
 [46.010](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/1662/2589.gif) by Dave Chau (USA)   
   
Congratulations to all our participants!   
   
   
\* \* \* \* \*   
BY POPULAR DEMAND, we've decided to print a second shirt, and we'll choose it by popular vote from a selected group of the top entries. Details to follow, stay tuned. We're prepping the HTML as we speak.   
\* \* \* \* \*   
   
Finally, for those of you who went out and bought jugs of milk and now have unruly, hairy, green, gelatinous masses, our sincere apologies ![:)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) You can throw them out now.
author: Jared Benson

\* THE VOTING BOOTH IS OPEN! \*   
   
Between now and December 14th, cast your votes for the second Typophile Tee ("Popular Vote").   
   
Each individual may submit only ONE (1) ballot, but you get three votes, so make them count! You may cast them all toward one favorite design, or you can distribute them as you wish among 2 or 3 shirt designs.   
   
Our top 20 finalists were chosen by Joe and I, based on comments and critiques posted by you throughout the contest, with our own personal favorites thrown in for good measure.   
   
Vote at: [http://www.typophile.com/vote/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020095038/http:/www.typophile.com/vote/)   
   
We'll announce the winner on December 15th, and then it's off to the screen shop!
